name: conjointly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves two or more people or things working together: The monarch exercises power conjointly with the government. The database was developed conjointly by three leading institutions.
More examplesFewer examplesProfessor Mendez founded the research programme conjointly with a number of other leading scientists.For the first two years of her reign she ruled conjointly with her brother. I was the executor of my father's will, acting conjointly with my older sister.
